what: One Function To Get all possible Survival Curves
title: Survival Curves
text: following behaviour survivals function demonstrated. start getting model parameters example calibration:
code: calibration <- kwbGompitz::exampleCalibration()  param <- kwbGompitz:::get_survival_parameters(calibration, "Cast Iron")  alphas <- param$alpha

title: Survival Curves
code: args <- list(t = 1:5, bz1 = -1, bz0 = 1, marginal = FALSE, set_attributes = FALSE)

title: Survival Curves
code: kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args, alpha = alphas) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args, alpha = alphas[1:2]) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args, alpha = alphas[1])

title: Survival Curves
code: args_2 <- kwb.utils::arglist(args, matrix = FALSE)  kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_2, alpha = alphas) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_2, alpha = alphas[1:2]) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_2, alpha = alphas[1])

title: Survival Curves
code: args_3 <- kwb.utils::arglist(args, marginal = TRUE, s = 0.1)  kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_3, alpha = alphas) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_3, alpha = alphas[1:2]) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_3, alpha = alphas[1])  args_4 <- kwb.utils::arglist(args_3, t = 10)  kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_4, alpha = alphas) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_4, alpha = alphas[1:2]) kwb.utils::callWith(kwbGompitz::survivals, args_4, alpha = alphas[1])

title: How to Use the Package
text: Install package remotes CRAN Install package kwbGompitz GitHub
code: # Install the package "remotes" from CRAN install.packages("remotes")  # Set the authentification token (ask hauke.sonnenberg@kompetenz-wasser.de) auth_token <- "1aa89..."  # Install the development version of package "kwbGompitz" from GitHub devtools::install_github(   "kwb-r/kwbGompitz@dev",    auth_token = auth_token,    build_opts = c("--no-resave-data", "--no-manual") )

title: How to Use the Package
text: package wrapper around model GompitZ Yves Le Gat. explained Gompitz User’s manual. copy manual contained package. able open running following commands:

title: How to Use the Package
text: first step need provide data sewer pipe inspections. following create small fake dataset scratch. dataset needs data frame one row per pipe per inspection. expected contain pipe’s master data well results pipe inspections (). Master data must comprise least: pipe identifier, pipe length, installation year pipe name cohort (= stratum) pipe belongs . Pipe inspections must given pairs inspection year inspected condition. pipe inspected, one row pipe columns inspection year inspected condition left blank (NA). pipe inspected, must many rows pipe inspections pipe. following case pipe “p1”. inspected twice. pipe’s length expected column named “LENGTH”.
code: inspections <- data.frame(   cohort = c("main", "main", "main", "main", "main", "main"),    pipe_id = c("p1", "p1", "p2", "p3", "p4", "p5"),   LENGTH = c(50, 50, 60, 55, 58, 53),   installation_year = as.integer(c(1920, 1920, 1940, 1960, 1930, 1980)),   inspection_year = as.integer(c(1970, 2010, 2000, 2010, 1995, 2015)),   condition = c("good", "bad", "good", "good", "bad", "good"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  # Just to verify that the fake data look reasonable: calculate the age inspections$age <- inspections$inspection_year - inspections$installation_year  # Have a look at what we created. Does that look reasonable? Pipes older than  # 50 years are in bad condition inspections #>   cohort pipe_id LENGTH installation_year inspection_year condition age #> 1   main      p1     50              1920            1970      good  50 #> 2   main      p1     50              1920            2010       bad  90 #> 3   main      p2     60              1940            2000      good  60 #> 4   main      p3     55              1960            2010      good  50 #> 5   main      p4     58              1930            1995       bad  65 #> 6   main      p5     53              1980            2015      good  35

title: How to Use the Package
text: package provides function aims getting overview inspection data. Try :
code: kwbGompitz::plot_pipe_conditions(   inspections,    column_instyear = "installation_year",    column_ident = "pipe_id",    column_inspyear = "inspection_year",    column_condition = "condition",    colour_values = c(bad = "red", good = "green") )

title: How to Use the Package
text: Create status matrix, simple possible: covariates length influence ageing See Gompitz User’s Guide described .
code: # Select the columns that are required by the model masterdata <- kwbGompitz:::composeMasterData(   stratum = inspections$cohort,   pipeid = inspections$pipe_id,    instyear = inspections$installation_year,    inspyear = inspections$inspection_year,    condition = inspections$condition ) status_matrix <- kwbGompitz::createStatusMatrix(   strata = unique(inspections$cohort),   covariates = c(LENGTH = 0) ) #> Note: the first covariate ('LENGTH') is assumed to refer to the column in Data containing the pipe lengths!  # Compose the input data for the model input_data <- kwbGompitz::composeGompitzInputData(   masterdata = masterdata,    covariates.status = status_matrix,   covariates = inspections[, "LENGTH", drop = FALSE],   weight = 1,   condition.labels = c("good", "bad") ) #> Argument 'weight' has been recycled to a vector of length 6.

title: How to Use the Package
code: calibration <- kwbGompitz::runGompitzCalibration(input.data = input_data) #> === Writing input file observations_cal.txt... === ok. #> === Running gompcal ... #> === Back from gompcal.  # Plot the survival curves for the only stratum "main" kwbGompitz::plot_survival_curves(calibration) #> $main

title: How to Use the Package
code: prediction <- kwbGompitz::runGompitzPrediction(   input_data,    calibration = calibration,    range.years = c(2020, 2070) ) #> Observed condition classes are NOT considered. #> === Writing input file observations_val.txt... === ok. #> === Running gompred ... #> === Back from gompred. #> Warning: 'default.stringsAsFactors' is deprecated. #> Use '`stringsAsFactors = FALSE`' instead. #> See help("Deprecated")  # Rename column "PredictionYear" to "InspectionYear"  # (unfortunately the functions to not fit well together...) prediction_for_plot <- kwb.utils::renameColumns(prediction, list(   PredictionYear = "InspectionYear" ))  # Plot the prediction kwbGompitz:::plotPrediction(prediction_for_plot, do_print = FALSE) +   ggplot2::scale_x_discrete(breaks = seq(2020, 2070, by = 5))

code: @Manual{,   title = {kwbGompitz: Interface to GompitZ Tool for Modelling the Degradation of Sewer Pipelines},   author = {Hauke Sonnenberg},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.8.0},   url = {https://github.com/kwb-r/kwbGompitz}, }

title:
Interface to GompitZ Tool for Modelling the Degradation of Sewer
    Pipelines
text: details install KWB-R packages checkout installation tutorial.
code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'kwbGompitz' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/kwbGompitz")

title: Compose Input Data for Gompitz Functions — composeGompitzInputData
text: masterdata data.frame containing master data retrieved  composeMasterData covariates data.frame containing covariates columns. Must many rows masterdata weight weight given inspection (row) masterdata. vector length rows masterdata. Default: 1 covariates.status matrix covariate status retrieved  createStatusMatrix condition.labels possible condition labels, e.g. c("1", "2", "3", "4"). Default: unique values column "condition" masterdata warn TRUE (default), warning given weight expected length

title: Compose Input Data for Gompitz Functions — composeGompitzInputData
text: list elements masterdata (data.frame), covariates (data.frame), weight (numeric vector), covariates.status (numeric matrix) condition.labels (character vector)

what: Copy Model Parameters from one Stratum to another — copyParameters
title: Copy Model Parameters from one Stratum to another — copyParameters
text: Copy Model Parameters one Stratum another

title: Copy Model Parameters from one Stratum to another — copyParameters
code: copyParameters(calibration, from = NULL, to = NULL, dbg = TRUE)

title: Copy Model Parameters from one Stratum to another — copyParameters
text: calibration calibration object returned runGompitzCalibration name stratum copy parameters vector names strata parameters copied . given, parameters copied strata model parameters converge. dbg TRUE (default) debug messages shown

title: Copy Model Parameters from one Stratum to another — copyParameters
code: if (FALSE) { # Get an example calibration calibration <- kwbGompitz::exampleCalibration()  # Check for which strata the model parameters converged checkConvergence(calibration, do.warn = FALSE)  # Copy parameters from a stratum for which the model parameters converged # to a stratum for which the model parameters did not converge calibration <- copyParameters(calibration, from = "Cast Iron", to = "Concrete")  # Check again checkConvergence(calibration, do.warn = FALSE)  # The following gives a warning (no convergence for source stratum) and returns # the calibration unchanged calibration <- copyParameters(calibration, "Clay", "Brick")  # The following gives a warning (differing distinct condition classes) and # returns the calibration unchanged calibration <- copyParameters(calibration, "Cast Iron", "Brick") }

title: Default Covariate Status Matrix — createStatusMatrix
text: strata names strata (e.g. unique values column stratum masterdata) covariateNames names covariates default.default status value used cell matrix, except cells column LENGTH. Default: 3 default.length status value used column LENGTH. Default: 0 covariates names columns Data shall used covariates Data data frame one row per inspection column.strata name column Data containing stratifying variable. Default: "Material_cat", .e. strata built material column.length name column Data containing pipe lengths note TRUE (default) note length column given

code: y1 <- c(1, 1, 1) y2 <- c(0.1, 0.5, 0.8) n <- 10  y <- interpolate_between(y1, y2, n) barplot(y, beside = TRUE)   # Compare the performance of slightly different implementations microbenchmark::microbenchmark(   v1 = interpolate_between(y1, y2, n, version = 1),   v2 = interpolate_between(y1, y2, n, version = 2),   v3 = interpolate_between(y1, y2, n, version = 3),   times = 1000,   check = function(x) kwb.utils::allAreIdentical(x[2:3]) &&     all(kwb.utils::almostEqual(x[[1]], x[[2]])) ) #> Unit: microseconds #>  expr  min   lq    mean median   uq   max neval #>    v1 20.5 21.0 21.6326   21.3 21.7  68.4  1000 #>    v2  9.1  9.5  9.8787    9.7 10.0  38.9  1000 #>    v3  8.6  9.1  9.7737    9.3  9.6 201.9  1000

title: Generate gg-plot of Stacked Bars — plot_stacked_bars
code: values <- c(   0, 2, 0, 0, 0,   1, 0, 0, 2, 0,   0, 0, 0, 2, 5,   0, 0, 3, 0, 0 )  conditionStat <- matrix(values, nrow = 4, byrow = TRUE, dimnames = list(   condition = paste0("prob", 1:4),   year = 2001:2005 ))  # Get the base plot baseplot <- kwbGompitz::plot_stacked_bars(conditionStat, legend = "right")  # Show the base plot baseplot   # Modify the base plot (titles, axis titles, legend title, legend content) baseplot + ggplot2::labs(   x = "Jahr", y = "Anteil Kanaele in %", title = "Zustandsverteilung",   subtitle = "Netzwerk: Berlin" ) + ggplot2::guides(fill = ggplot2::guide_legend("Zustandsklasse")) + ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(   values = c("darkgreen", "yellow", "darkorange3", "red3"),   labels = c("good", "ok", "not so good", "bad") ) #> Scale for 'fill' is already present. Adding another scale for 'fill', which #> will replace the existing scale.

text: calibration calibration object stratum name stratum marginal logical. TRUE (default) marginal survival curves plotted, otherwise non-marginal survival curves t vector times calculate survival curves col vector colour names, named according conditions stored attr(calibration, "parameters")$conditions ... arguments passed plot_curve_areas_gg, legend, line_colour args arguments passed get_survivals

title: Plot Survival Curves — plot_survival_curves
code: if (FALSE) { # Get the example calibration provided with the Gompitz software calibration <- kwbGompitz::exampleCalibration()  # Generate one ggplot2-object for each calibrated stratum (plots_1 <- plot_survival_curves(calibration))  # By default the marginal survival curves are shown. You may set marginal to # FALSE to get the non-marginal survival curves (plots_2 <- plot_survival_curves(calibration, marginal = FALSE))  # Compare the plots gridExtra::grid.arrange(plots_1[[1]], plots_2[[1]], plots_1[[2]], plots_2[[2]]) }

Possible values: "unix", "win32", "win32_kwb" use.data.table TRUE, fread used read result file

title: kwbGompitz 0.8.0
text: Harmonise R package kwb.pkgbuild

title: kwbGompitz 0.7.0
text: new: checkInputData() createExampleFiles(): create output files existing binary versions improve error handling rename functions whose names start dot fix bug get_default_colours_for_labels() add argument “digits_exp” readParameters() writeParameters() Add new function reformatScientific().

title: kwbGompitz 0.6.1
text: composeGompitzInputData(): default, give message instead warning weight vector recycled desired length. Bug fix: exclude empty condition labels getting unique values condition column. Convert condition labels factor character. rename functions whose names start dot functions loaded global environment kwb.utils::assignPackageObjects() called.

title: kwbGompitz 0.1.7
text: .getParameterEstimates(): data frame five columns, NA returned (suggested Nicolas Caradot)

title: kwbGompitz 0.1.6
kwbGompitz 0.1.5
text: new arg “verbose” functions runGompitzCalibration(), runGompcal(), runGompcalInDirectory(), readCalibrationResultFromFile(), createTemporyGompitzDirAndReturnPath(), runGompitzPrediction(), runGompredInDirectory(), runGompred()

title: kwbGompitz 0.1.4
text: new functions: composeGompitzInputData(), runGompitzCalibration(), runGompitzPrediction(), noCalibrationAvailableForStratum(), survivalFunction() gompcal supported anymore, use runGompitzCalibration() instead. gompred0 supported anymore, use runGompitzPrediction() instead. .getFileContentForInputFile(): new arg “weight” getInputFileBody: weight default value (1) . input data gompcal() written observations_cal.txt input data gompred() written observations_val.txt

title: kwbGompitz 0.1.3
text: new function: .getFileContentForInputFile() getObservationByCondition(): use unlist prevent bug
